intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: You look as if you’re feeling better after a few days to yourself, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I am, yes. I still have many questions, but at least now I have a few answers. Thank you for giving me the space I needed to think.

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: Of course. I’m glad to hear you’re feeling better. If you wouldn’t mind, I have a small favor to ask. Would you try sitting on the throne for a moment?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Why would I do that?

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: Well…this throne is infused with the power of the First Dragons. It is said that those who sit on it regain their true form and mind. I thought if you sat on the throne, then perhaps-

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Wait… Do you not trust me? Do you think I’m under some kind of Nohrian spell?

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: No! It has nothing to do with trust. I just wonder if the Nohrians have been sealing away your early memories… If so, maybe this special throne could help bring those lost pieces back. Those sweet memories of me and your siblings…

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I see.

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: I’m sorry, Corrin. I don’t mean to push you toward something you don’t want.

intro.speaker: Yukimura
intro.line: Excuse me, Lady Mikoto. The ceremony is about to begin.

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: Thank you, Yukimura. Corrin, you probably don’t remember him, but this is Yukimura. He’s one of our strategists and brightest leaders. We would be lost without him!

intro.speaker: Yukimura
intro.line: You are too kind, milady. Though in truth, I still have much to learn. That said, I am here to help in any way I can, Lord/Lady Corrin.

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: I’d like to make a public announcement about your presence here, Corrin. There have been rumors circulating about spies from Nohr infiltrating the castle. I would like to quash those rumors once and for all. Yukimura, is everything ready?

intro.speaker: Yukimura
intro.line: Yes, milady. People are beginning to gather at the plaza.

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: Excellent. Thank you. Corrin, I’ve arranged for Takumi, Hinoka, and Sakura to give you a tour. I thought you might want to get to know the area a little bit before this event. I need to speak with Yukimura first, but I’ll meet you at the plaza soon.

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: We’d be happy to show him/her around. Thank you, Mother.

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: Azura, do you mind going with them as well?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Not at all. It would be my pleasure.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Azura.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Of course, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Hmph.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: I can’t wait to show you around! I think you’ll l-love it here.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Sakura. A guided tour sounds like a great idea.

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: I hope Corrin is truly OK with all of this…

intro.speaker: Yukimura
intro.line: Yes, I can’t imagine the position he’s/she's in. It’s a lot to process. That said, I think his/her return is a message from the gods.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: A good message, I hope.

intro.speaker: Yukimura
intro.line: Why do you say that?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: I don’t know. After that invasion up north, I just feel uneasy. We should remain on high alert, if you ask me.

intro.speaker: Old Woman
intro.line: Hey, young man/lady! Would you like to try my world-famous roasted potatoes? They’re delicious and nutritious! I guarantee you’ll love ’em.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well…sure! Why not? Mmm…I’ve never tasted spices like these before. This is amazing!

intro.speaker: Old Woman
intro.line: Ha ha! Told ya! Here, take an extra one on the house. Share it with your lady friend!/friend!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well, thank you very much! Here you go, Azura.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Thank you, Corrin. Mmm, you’re right. This is delicious.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Everyone really is friendly here. And it’s so…bright…and open. It’s quite a contrast from the fortress I grew up in.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I’m glad you like it. Like I said, I’ve always been happy here.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Just don’t get too comfortable…BROTHER/SISTER.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Pardon me?

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: I don’t trust you. Shouldn’t you be heading back to Nohr soon?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Takumi…

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Hey, who said you could call me by name? You haven’t earned that privilege either.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That doesn’t even make sense.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Excuse me?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Azura has been in Hoshido for as long as I’ve been gone. Shouldn’t that be enough to consider her part of the family?

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: I don’t care. I don’t trust either of you. I just wanted to tell you that to your face.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: I apologize for Takumi’s rudeness. He’s a bit of a hothead. Anyway, how’d you like to try a sweet rice dumpling? It’s a Hoshidan specialty!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I’d love to. Thanks, Sakura!

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: You’re welcome!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You know, I’m very close with a girl in Nohr who’s around your age.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Oh? What's she like?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well, she's generous and kind. Always putting the need of others first...

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: All right, everyone. The ceremony is starting. Let’s head to the plaza!

cutscene.speaker: Mikoto
cutscene.line: You were not hurt? Tell me you’re OK.

cutscene.speaker: Ryoma
cutscene.line: It's an ancient dragon. I never thought I’d see the day…

battle.speaker: Azura
battle.line: Corrin! A word of warning, if you can hear me. Watch out for enemies carrying Wyrmslayers! They’re a type of blade designed to pierce dragon scales-and they work!

battle.speaker: Azura
battle.line: Corrin, listen! My song can help you win this battle. Using it can give you another chance to attack or take cover in a pinch. Please don’t hesitate to ask me for help!

battle.speaker: Ryoma
battle.line: Be careful, everyone! These enemies are no mere Faceless. One wrong move and they’re perfectly capable of ending you. I hope we can count on Corrin even in this new form…

battle.speaker: Sakura
battle.line: Watch out for magical attacks, Corrin! Your defense against physical attacks is strong…but you’ll need higher resistance to protect yourself against mages.

boss.line: Show me…what you’ve got. Heh. Heh. Heh…

boss.speaker: Ryoma
boss.line: Vengeance will be mine... Prepare to die!

character-falls.speaker: Ryoma
character-falls.line: You can kill me, but you cannot kill the spirit of Hoshido!

character-falls.speaker: Sakura
character-falls.line: Brother, no! You have to step back! We can’t afford to lose you…

character-falls.speaker: Ryoma
character-falls.line: Ugh…you’re right. I’ll retreat for now…

character-falls.speaker: Azura
character-falls.line: No! You can't die like this, Corrin! What are we going to do without you...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: My real father…

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Are you all right, Corrin?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, I’m fine. Just disgusted with myself. Are you OK? I can’t believe what I just did to you. It was like…I had no control over myself.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Please don’t worry about it. That wasn’t you. It was the blood of the ancient dragon that runs in your veins.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I thought only the Nohrian royal family had dragon blood.

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: The blood of the Dusk Dragon runs in the Nohrian royal family. And the blood of the Dawn Dragon runs through ours. But you’re special, Corrin. You can actually take the form of a dragon.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I’ve heard of such a thing. But this is my first time seeing it in real life…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: … Never mind me. What happened to all the innocent people in town?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I can’t believe this. The entire town…devastated. An hour ago these streets were filled with vendors and children and…

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: So you see, Corrin. This is the work of the Nohrians. This is what they do. Let me guess. That sword you carried…was it a gift from King Garon?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: He masterminded the whole thing. It’s not your fault. He knew you’ll be captured and brought before the queen…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But why? Why would he do this? I’m so sorry I couldn’t see it coming…

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Your apology means NOTHING.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: This is all your fault! Mother is dead, along with countless others. And it wouldn’t have happened if you hadn’t shown up on our doorstep. You don’t belong here!

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: Enough, Takumi!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Your words don’t change anything. And besides-

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Shut up, Azura! You’re no different than Corrin. An interloper.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Takumi…

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Don’t speak my name! I don’t want to see you again. Are we really to believe you had no idea this would happen?

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Takumi, what are you saying? Knock it off! You just saw Corrin help us defeat those Nohrian soldiers!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Takumi, please. You must listen. Corrin is your brother/sister. If you don’t trust me, that’s one thing. But Corrin is your own blood.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Mother is dead. Thanks to him/her. He’s/She's not my brother/sister.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I’m so sorry, everyone. I’ve brought nothing but pain to all of you. It would be better if I’d never come here— maybe I should just leave.

end.speaker: Yukimura
end.line: Please wait. I don’t believe that’s what Queen Mikoto would have wanted.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: What do you know about it, Yukimura?

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: What do you mean? Did she say something to you?

end.speaker: Yukimura
end.line: I hate to deliver this news, but… Queen Mikoto foresaw her own death. This isn’t your fault, Corrin. King Garon set these events in motion. And the queen speculated that there may be an even darker force at work. She didn’t know when or how death would strike, only that it was certain. And there’s one other thing. Please take a look at that statue.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Is that…a sword?

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: It can’t be…

end.speaker: Yukimura
end.line: It is. The divine sword Yato. Much like your weapon, Ryoma. The divine Raijinto… And your Fujin Yumi, Takumi... Yato may be wielded by only a singular warrior. One who is chosen by the blade itself. It is said that the Yato was forged to be the key to peace in our world.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: The key to peace…

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: The blade has chosen Corrin!

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Impossible.

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Corrin, do you know what this means?

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: Corrin? Are you listening? Can you h-hear us?

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Lord Ryoma! I have important news. A massive Nohrian force is gathering at our border.

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: This is the final straw. I have worked hard to avoid an all-out war, but now… Death is too good for them. Who’s with me?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: There must be another way. Surely the answer is not more bloodshed. But I feel I must follow Ryoma to the border. If I can help avert total war…

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Wait, Corrin! There’s something you need to know. If you become embroiled in a fight right now, it would be easy to lose control. Your dragon blood could take over again. And if you yield completely to the dragon, you may lose your humanity altogether.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Is there anything I can do?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes. This is called a Dragonstone. It will allow you to control the dragon’s power and still return to your human form. Now, please close your eyes…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Very well…

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: … There. You should be OK now. This Dragonstone is now attuned to you. Be sure to keep it safe.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thank you, Azura. I don’t know what I’d do without you.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Oh! Um…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I’m sorry. Did I make you uncomfortable? I know we’ve known each other only a short while, but I feel close to you. You already risked your life to help calm my dragon form. I only hope I can repay the favor someday.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Thank you, Corrin. I feel close to you as well. I feel…safe when I’m with you. I wish to keep you safe too. That’s why I’m coming with you to face Nohr.

flashback.speaker: Garon
flashback.line: I’m disappointed in you, Sumeragi. *sinister laugh* That wasn’t even my best trap.

flashback.speaker: Garon
flashback.line: You poor thing. Orphaned at such…a tender young age. You are my child now.
